questions.text: Which of the following is the most common epilepsy in children?

2-year-old child is admitted for work up of weight loss and recurrent pneumonia episodes. He also has greasy stools and is born to consanguineous marriage. Sputum culture shows Burkholderia cepacia. Which of the following test is best to confirm the diagnosis of this patient?
Which of the following is not a feature of simple febrile convulsions?

choices.text: IV diazepam for prevention of episodes

questions.text: During post-round you notice a swelling on the head of a neonate born early morning to a vaginal delivery aided by a ventouse. You reassure the mother about self-resolution of this swelling. Diagnosis is?
Correct intervention for breast feeding jaundice?

choices.text: Stop breast feeding and start formula feeds for one week
Use Bili-blanket at home and call daily for follow up
Phototherapy in NICU and take consent for exchange transfusion

questions.text: A premature 32-week boy born with a weight of 1.4 kg is having a shrill cry. On examination an asymmetric moro reflex with bulging anterior fontanelle is seen. Which of the following investigations should be done on this child on first priority?
Which of the following can a three old child perform?

A 6-month-old child with weight of 6 kg is brought to PHC in an unconscious state. Mother says that he has been having watery loose motions since last night and she has stopped counting after 10 episodes. On examination the child is listless, femoral pulses are thready and skin pinch is delayed to 5 seconds. Calculate the initial correction that will be given to this infant?

A 4 kg male baby is born to primigravida with gestational diabetes mellitus using a ventouse. He has macrosomia with hair on the pinna and has vigorous cry. Which of the following is correct about this baby?
Which of the following is seen in Down syndrome?
A 6-month child is having tet spells. CXR is shown below. Which is correct about first line management of this presentation?
Congenital malformations develop in developing fetuses. Which of these is the most common one seen?

choices.text: Congenital adrenal hyperplasia, salt wasting type

questions.text: 2 kg term small for gestational age neonate is having icterus on day 1 of life involving palms and soles. Total serum bilirubin is 20 mg/dl, unconjugated Bilirubin 18 mg/dl. Which of the following investigations should be done first to identify the cause?

choices.text: Apt test for swallowed maternal blood

questions.text: Mother in your OPD tells that her neonate born at home on day 1 is having poor attachment to breast and she is not able to breast feed. On examination child has dusky blue discoloration of lips and fingertips. O2 was started but cyanosis is persisting. CXR is shown below. Diagnosis is?
Leading cause of conjugated hyperbilirubinemia in children?

A short stature girl is brought to OPD with complaints of dusky blue colour of her toes. On examination she has a webbing of neck and low hair line. Nipples are hypoplastic and the carrying angle at the elbow is increased. Radio-femoral delay is present. Karyotyping reveals 45XO. Which of the following cardiovascular conditions is responsible for this presentation?

A 4-year-old child is brought unconscious and unresponsive after electrocution to CHC. You start giving CPR to this child. What is the ratio of chest compressions: rescue breaths when you are the only health care provider available on duty?
A 25-year-old lady on lithium was conceived accidentally. Which of the following heart valves is likely to be malformed?
Leading cause of congenital hypothyroidism?
Dried blood spot from heel prick for diagnosis of congenital hypothyroidism is done at which time frame?

Neonate is having respiratory distress on day 1 of life. On examination, scaphoid abdomen is noted. CXR shows apparent dextrocardia and dilated bowel loops on the left side of the chest. Which of the following is correct about this presentation?

choices.text: Defect between sternal and costal margins of diaphragm
Occurs due to persistent pleuroperitoneal canal
Anteriorly placed herniation of bowel contents into chest wall

questions.text: Leading cause of immunogenic hydrops fetalis
Advanced bone age is seen in which of the following?

A full-term newborn is evaluated at 1 minute of life. The following observations are made:

Heart rate: 120/min

Respiratory effort: slow, irregular

Muscle tone: some flexion of extremities

Reflex irritability: No response

Colour: body pink, extremities blue

What is the APGAR score of this newborn?
A Child can play vocal tennis and fixate on an object in midline at which age in months?
A 2-year-old child presents with developmental delay, seizures, hypopigmented skin and a mousy odor to urine. Which enzyme deficiency is responsible?

A 6-year-old boy presents with massive splenomegaly, anemia, and bone pain. Bone marrow aspirate shows macrophages with a “crumpled tissue paper” cytoplasm. This condition is most commonly due to mutation in which gene located on which chromosome?
A 6-month-old infant presents with hypoglycemia, hepatomegaly, and lactic acidosis. Which test is diagnostic for confirming Von Gierke disease?
Which of the following is NOT a sign of correct attachment of baby to the breast?

choices.text: More areola visible below than above the mouth

questions.text: In boys the first visible sign of puberty is
In which neural tube defect, surgical repair is feasible and can increase survival?
A child is admitted with a diagnosis of TB meningitis. Which of the following is not correct about this condition?

choices.text: Give mannitol to reduce vasogenic cerebral oedema

questions.text: Ejection systolic murmur with wide fixed split S2 is seen in which of the following congenital heart disease
Leading cause of short stature is?
The leading cause of respiratory distress in a baby born by LSCS 1 hour ago is?
A 2-year-old exclusively breast-fed child is brought to hospital with following chest wall deformities and inability to walk. X ray of extremities is shown. Diagnosis is

Neonate born at 38 weeks of gestation, in the first few hours of life, develops frothing, bubbling and drooling of saliva. Mother says she noticed regurgitation of initial feeds with choking and cyanosis when feeding was done in presence of medical staff. Which of the following investigations should be done next?

choices.text: CXR with NG tube in situ

questions.text: Term neonate on day1 develops bilious vomiting without abdominal distention. X-ray Abdomen is shown below. Best intervention is

A 38-week neonate is brought with gross abdominal distention on day 3 of life. On enquiry mother says that meconium has been passed. Digital rectal examination shows empty rectum followed by passage of toothpaste like stool. Which of the following testing should be done to confirm the diagnosis?

A 34-week-old preterm girl child delivered at home was started on cow milk feeds by grandmother as mother was admitted due to puerperal sepsis. She develops haematochezia and is brought to hospital with abdominal distention. Clinical diagnosis is?

A 4-year-old child presents with swelling all over the body. Work up shows proteinuria > 40 mg /m2 BSA with hypoalbuminemia. KFT is normal. C3 levels are normal. USG shows normal size kidneys. What is best treatment for this case
The 5-year-old girl is having fever, abdominal pain and dysuria. Following work up was done by consultant and he is asking you to identify the investigation performed

Mother brings her 5-year-old girl child due to peculiar appearance of genitals. You notice clitoral hypertrophy with labia minora fusion and hyperpigmentation around genitals. USG shows uterus with ovaries. Karyotyping reveals 46 XX Which of the following is the first differential diagnosis?
A 2-year-old boy is brought for a poor urinary stream. On examination external urinary meatus is normal. Per abdomen shows a dilated urinary bladder. First differential diagnosis is?
Which of the following is the cause of death in case of measles?
Earliest manifestation of neonatal syphilis is?
Microcephaly and periventricular calcification is seen in which of the following?
The following changes are seen in
2-year-old is diagnosed to have an abdominal mass. USG shows mass origination from the left supra renal gland. Testing shows 24-hour urinary VMA levels to be elevated. Diagnosis is
Which of the following is not seen in marasmus?

choices.text: Early recovery and less prone to infections

questions.text: Severe acute malnutrition is defined as MAC less than?
Ideal temperature of neonatal resuscitation room should be?
Ideal route of drug administration in neonatal resuscitation is?
Bag and mask ventilation is contraindicated in all except?
Which of the following is not a neural tube defect?

A 2-day-old female neonate presents with a large mass arising from the sacrococcygeal region. The swelling is predominantly external, well-circumscribed, and non-tender. The ultrasound abdomen shows no significant intra-pelvic extension. Serum alpha-fetoprotein is elevated. Which of the following is the most appropriate management?

choices.text: Excision of the mass with coccygectomy

questions.text: A child presents with fever and following lesions. Likely a causative agent is?

A child from Kashmir is brought with complaints of fever, headache and rash on the entire body including palms and soles. On examination hepatosplenomegaly is present. Welix-felix reaction is positive. Diagnosis is?
A patient with Kawasaki disease is having large coronary artery aneurysms. Which is correct about its management?
This child is admitted to ICU with high grade fever and extensive skin desquamation as shown in the image. What is the cause?
The following sign is seen in?

A 10-year-old child was having multiple vomiting episodes after consuming mithai (milk- products) at a school function. He was given injection metoclopramide 10 mg following which he developed the bizarre postures of face like sustained grimacing ______________________. What should be the line of treatment?

choices.text: Reassure and send home with ORS and domperidone
Admit and give IV Ringer lactate

questions.text: Girl child is brought with complaints of loss of purposeful hand movements, hand washing movements and developmental regression. Work up shows MECP2 mutation. Diagnosis is

A 5-year-old child being worked up for weight loss and iron deficiency is found to have scalloped duodenal mucosa. Small intestinal mucosal biopsy shows villous atrophy. Which of the following food items can be given to this child?

A 10-year-old child with progressive pallor is brought to hospital. On examination you notice petechiae around ankles and purpura on buttocks and thighs. Per abdomen examination is normal and no bony tenderness is noted. Work up show Hb 9 gm%, TLC 8000/cu.mm and platelet count is 30,000/ cu.mm. Bone marrow shows normocellular marrow with megakaryocyte hyperplasia. Diagnosis is:

A 12-month-old child is brought with mother reporting difficulty in crawling. You notice that the child does commando crawling. He was born a preterm child and has global developmental delay. Diagnosis is?

An 8-year-old child is brought into an unconscious state. He had been complaining of abdominal epigastric pain for the last 2 days with multiple episodes of vomiting. On examination pulse is thready, BP is not recordable. Venous blood gas sample shows pH: 7.3, pC02= 30 mm Hg, HCO3=15 meq/L and RBS is 400 mg/dl. Urine ketostix is 4+. Which of the following is the next best step intervention as per ISPAD guidelines?

choices.text: Insulin bolus followed by insulin infusion
Normal saline 0.9% over 1 hour followed by insulin infusion
Normal saline 0.9% boluses @20 ml per Kg followed by normal saline 0.9% infusion for 1 hours
Perform ABG as VBG is not reliable for diagnosis of metabolic acidosis

questions.text: Which of the following should be given for management of hidden hunger in Indian population?
A 2-year-old child weighing of 10 kg develops acute gastroenteritis with some dehydration. How much ORT should be given to this patient?

choices.text: 300 ml over first 4 hours + 10 ml / kg/ Stool
700 ml over first 4 hours + 10 ml / kg/ Stool
750 ml over first 4 hours + 10 ml / Kg/ Stool
1000 ml over first 4 hours +10 ml /kg/ stool

questions.text: Leading cause of delayed closure of anterior fontanelle is?

You are examining an 8-month-old infant in a well baby clinic. You notice widening of wrist joint with frontal bossing. In work up: X-Ray of wrist joint is shown below, serum calcium is low, serum phosphate is low and SAP is elevated. Which of the following is correct about the management?

choices.text: 6,000 IU of vitamin D3 with supplemental calcium daily for 10 days
60,000 IU of vitamin D3 with supplemental calcium daily for 10 days
200,000 IU of vitamin D3 with supplemental calcium daily for 10 days
600,000 IU of vitamin D3 with supplemental calcium daily for 10 days

questions.text: A 2-year-old child is brought by mother saying that the child cries a lot at night. You notice the following eye findings. Which is correct management?

choices.text: 2 Lac IU oral vitamin A single dose
2 Lac IU of Oral Vitamin A daily every 6 months till the age of 5 years
2 Lac IU of Oral Vitamin A on day 0,1, 14
2 Lac IU of Oral Vitamin A on day 0, 1,14,28

questions.text: 3-year-old child presents with high grade fever for 1 day with dysphagia, drooling of saliva and muffled voice. On examination the child has adopted a sniffing position and stridor is heard. X-ray of neck is shown below. Which of the following should not be done in this case?
Which of the following is correct management of acute rheumatic carditis?
Definition of hypoxic ischemic encephalopathy is
